verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: If a soul sin, and commit a trespass against the LORD, and lie unto his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep, or in fellowship, or in a thing taken away by violence, or hath deceived his neighbour;
verses.ct: "If someone sins and acts unfaithfully against the LORD by lying to a neighbor about something entrusted to their care, or about a business deal, or about something stolen by force, or by cheating their neighbor,

verses.kjv: Or have found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein:
verses.ct: or if they find something that was lost and lie about it, or swear falsely — in any of these kinds of sins that people commit —

verses.kjv: Then it shall be, because he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took violently away, or the thing which he hath deceitfully gotten, or that which was delivered him to keep, or the lost thing which he found,
verses.ct: then since they have sinned and are guilty, they must return whatever they took by force, or whatever they gained through fraud, or whatever was entrusted to them, or the lost property they found,

verses.kjv: Or all that about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even restore it in the principal, and shall add the fifth part more thereto, and give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day of his trespass offering.
verses.ct: or anything they swore falsely about. They must pay back the full amount plus an additional 20 percent, giving it to the rightful owner on the day they present their guilt offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the LORD, a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest:
verses.ct: They must also bring their guilt offering to the LORD — a flawless ram from the flock, valued at the proper amount, as a guilt offering to the priest.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD: and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done in trespassing therein.
verses.ct: The priest will perform atonement for that person in the LORD's presence, and they will be forgiven for whatever they did that made them guilty."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the burnt offering: It is the burnt offering, because of the burning upon the altar all night unto the morning, and the fire of the altar shall be burning in it.
verses.ct: "Give Aaron and his sons these instructions: This is the regulation for the burnt offering. The burnt offering is to remain on the altar's hearth throughout the entire night until morning, and the altar fire must be kept burning.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh, and take up the ashes which the fire hath consumed with the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.
verses.ct: The priest must dress in his linen robe with linen undergarments worn next to his body. He is to remove the ashes left from the burnt offering consumed by the fire on the altar and place them next to the altar.

verses.kjv: And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.
verses.ct: Then he must change out of those clothes, put on different ones, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a ceremonially clean location.

verses.kjv: And the fire upon the altar shall be burning in it; it shall not be put out: and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt offering in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the fat of the peace offerings.
verses.ct: The fire on the altar must be kept burning and never allowed to go out. Every morning the priest must add wood to it, arrange the burnt offering on it, and burn the fat from the peace offerings on it.

verses.kjv: The fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go out.
verses.ct: The fire must burn continuously on the altar; it must never go out.

verses.kjv: And this is the law of the meat offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the LORD, before the altar.
verses.ct: This is the regulation for the grain offering: Aaron's sons are to present it in the LORD's presence, in front of the altar.

verses.kjv: And he shall take of it his handful, of the flour of the meat offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which is upon the meat offering, and shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savour, even the memorial of it, unto the LORD.
verses.ct: The priest is to take a handful of the fine flour from the grain offering, along with some of its oil and all the frankincense that is on it, and burn this portion on the altar as a pleasing aroma — a memorial portion to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the remainder thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat: with unleavened bread shall it be eaten in the holy place; in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation they shall eat it.
verses.ct: Aaron and his sons may eat whatever is left over. It must be eaten without yeast in a holy location — they are to eat it in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: It shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it unto them for their portion of my offerings made by fire; it is most holy, as is the sin offering, and as the trespass offering.
verses.ct: It must not be baked with yeast. I have assigned it as their share of my fire offerings. It is most holy, just like the sin offering and the guilt offering.

verses.kjv: All the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it. It shall be a statute for ever in your generations concerning the offerings of the LORD made by fire: every one that toucheth them shall be holy.
verses.ct: Every male descendant of Aaron may eat from it. This is a permanent rule throughout your generations regarding the LORD's fire offerings — anyone who touches them will become holy."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer unto the LORD in the day when he is anointed; the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meat offering perpetual, half of it in the morning, and half thereof at night.
verses.ct: "This is the offering that Aaron and his sons must present to the LORD on the day one of them is anointed: a 10th of an ephah of fine flour as a regular grain offering — half in the morning and half in the evening.

verses.kjv: In a pan it shall be made with oil; and when it is baken, thou shalt bring it in: and the baken pieces of the meat offering shalt thou offer for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.ct: It must be prepared with oil on a griddle. When it is thoroughly cooked, bring it in and offer the broken pieces of the grain offering as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: it is a statute for ever unto the LORD; it shall be wholly burnt.
verses.ct: Whichever of Aaron's descendants is anointed to succeed him as priest must prepare this offering. This is a permanent regulation — it must be completely burned for the LORD.

verses.kjv: For every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt: it shall not be eaten.
verses.ct: Every grain offering made by a priest must be completely burned. None of it may be eaten."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed shall the sin offering be killed before the LORD: it is most holy.
verses.ct: "Tell Aaron and his sons: This is the regulation for the sin offering. The sin offering must be slaughtered in the LORD's presence at the same place where the burnt offering is slaughtered. It is most holy.

verses.kjv: The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.ct: The priest who performs the sin offering must eat it. It must be eaten in a holy location — in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.
verses.ct: Anything that touches its meat will become holy. If any of its blood spatters on a piece of clothing, you must wash that garment in a holy location.

verses.kjv: But the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken: and if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall be both scoured, and rinsed in water.
verses.ct: Any clay pot used to boil the meat must be smashed. If it was boiled in a bronze pot, the pot must be scrubbed thoroughly and rinsed with water.

verses.kjv: All the males among the priests shall eat thereof: it is most holy.
verses.ct: Every male among the priests may eat from it. It is most holy.

verses.kjv: And no sin offering, whereof any of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to reconcile withal in the holy place, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt in the fire.
verses.ct: However, no sin offering may be eaten if any of its blood has been brought into the tent of meeting to make atonement in the holy place. That offering must be completely burned with fire."
